headline: Anthropic's new AI tools deepen selloff in data analytics and software stocks, investors say
summary: A significant selloff among U.S. and European data analytics, professional services and software companies deepened on Tuesday, with some investors pointing to a recently updated artificial intelligence chatbot by Anthropic as ​the main culprit.  AI developer Anthropic launched plug-ins for its Claude Cowork agent on Friday that would automate tasks across legal, sales, marketing and ‌data analysis.  Toronto-based Thomson Reuters, which owns the Westlaw legal database, slumped by nearly 18%.

content.title: Anthropic's new AI tools deepen selloff in data analytics and software stocks, investors say
content.summary: A significant selloff among U.S. and European data analytics, professional services and software companies deepened on Tuesday, with some investors pointing to a recently updated artificial intelligence chatbot by Anthropic as ​the main culprit.  AI developer Anthropic launched plug-ins for its Claude Cowork agent on Friday that would automate tasks across legal, sales, marketing and ‌data analysis.  Toronto-based Thomson Reuters, which owns the Westlaw legal database, slumped by nearly 18%.

headline: Alphabet Looks Stronger Ahead of Earnings. Focus Is on the Cloud.
summary: A year ago,  Alphabet’s  core property, Google Search, looked like it was in trouble.  Despite a decade of well-funded research on artificial intelligence, Google was still surprised by the capabilities of ChatGPT when it debuted in November 2022.  Google struggled to match AI models coming out of start-ups OpenAI and Anthropic, and web search was changing.

content.title: Alphabet Looks Stronger Ahead of Earnings. Focus Is on the Cloud.
content.summary: A year ago,  Alphabet’s  core property, Google Search, looked like it was in trouble.  Despite a decade of well-funded research on artificial intelligence, Google was still surprised by the capabilities of ChatGPT when it debuted in November 2022.  Google struggled to match AI models coming out of start-ups OpenAI and Anthropic, and web search was changing.

headline: Asian shares gained and gold and silver climb higher after a retreat on Wall St
summary: Asia shares traded mostly higher on Wednesday despite a retreat on Wall Street on selling of technology stocks, while gold and silver continued to regain ground after a recent sell-off. U.S. futures edged higher and oil prices advanced. The future for the S&P 500 edged up 0.2%, while that for the Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 0.3%.

content.title: Asian shares gained and gold and silver climb higher after a retreat on Wall St
content.summary: Asia shares traded mostly higher on Wednesday despite a retreat on Wall Street on selling of technology stocks, while gold and silver continued to regain ground after a recent sell-off. U.S. futures edged higher and oil prices advanced. The future for the S&P 500 edged up 0.2%, while that for the Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 0.3%.

headline: Semperis Acquires Identity Resilience Provider MightyID to Extend Identity Protection for Okta and Ping Multi-Cloud Environments
summary: Semperis, the identity-driven cyber resilience and crisis management company, today announced the acquisition of MightyID, the best-of-breed identity resilience specialist for leading cloud identity providers Okta and Ping. This acquisition allows Semperis to extend true cyber resilience with identity-first security and crisis management across complex hybrid identity environments including Microsoft Active Directory (AD), Entra ID, Okta and Ping.

This acquisition allows Semperis to extend true cyber resilience with identity-first security and crisis management across complex hybrid identity environments including Microsoft Active Directory (AD), Entra ID, Okta and Ping.

headline: Global software stocks hit by Anthropic wake-up call on AI disruption
summary: European and U.S. software stocks struggled to find support on Wednesday as a sector-wide selloff spread to Asia, fuelled by mounting worries that advances in artificial intelligence could upend companies' business ​models.  European data analytics, professional services and software stocks fell for a second day in volatile trade, mirroring losses in ‌global peers, after Anthropic's new legal artificial intelligence model underscored the threat to businesses seen as most exposed to AI disruption.  Shares of U.S. software and services firms were mixed in premarket trading after a near 13% slide over five straight sessions.

content.title: Global software stocks hit by Anthropic wake-up call on AI disruption
content.summary: European and U.S. software stocks struggled to find support on Wednesday as a sector-wide selloff spread to Asia, fuelled by mounting worries that advances in artificial intelligence could upend companies' business ​models.  European data analytics, professional services and software stocks fell for a second day in volatile trade, mirroring losses in ‌global peers, after Anthropic's new legal artificial intelligence model underscored the threat to businesses seen as most exposed to AI disruption.  Shares of U.S. software and services firms were mixed in premarket trading after a near 13% slide over five straight sessions.

headline: Cognizant forecasts annual revenue above estimates on strong AI demand
summary: Cognizant Technology forecast annual revenue above Wall Street estimates on Wednesday, betting on strong ​demand for its IT services as businesses adopt artificial ‌intelligence into their workflows. The company has benefited from enterprise clients prioritizing AI-related ‌digital projects, with sustained demand for its AI and cloud services boosting productivity, cutting costs and supporting growth as generative AI gains traction. "Our initial 2026 guidance reflects sustained momentum, backed ⁠by our commitment ‌to advancing our strategic investments aimed at accelerating our AI-led growth strategy," CFO Jatin Dalal ‍said.

content.title: Cognizant forecasts annual revenue above estimates on strong AI demand
content.summary: Cognizant Technology forecast annual revenue above Wall Street estimates on Wednesday, betting on strong ​demand for its IT services as businesses adopt artificial ‌intelligence into their workflows. The company has benefited from enterprise clients prioritizing AI-related ‌digital projects, with sustained demand for its AI and cloud services boosting productivity, cutting costs and supporting growth as generative AI gains traction. "Our initial 2026 guidance reflects sustained momentum, backed ⁠by our commitment ‌to advancing our strategic investments aimed at accelerating our AI-led growth strategy," CFO Jatin Dalal ‍said.

headline: AMD Struggles to Bridge the Gap Between AI Hope and Near-Term Reality
summary: AMD  is finding out how tough it can be when you’re riding high in the artificial-intelligence investment trade.  The stock had been one of the market’s top performers over the past six months, outpacing its larger rival,  Nvidia  by nearly 36% in terms of overall gains.  It also was up more than 40% from its early October close heading into the release Tuesday of fourth-quarter earnings, powered in part by a multi-billion dollar deal with OpenAI to deploy its next-generation GPUs in exchange for warrants that could see the ChatGPT maker owning as much as 10% of AMD outstanding stock.

content.title: AMD Struggles to Bridge the Gap Between AI Hope and Near-Term Reality
content.summary: AMD  is finding out how tough it can be when you’re riding high in the artificial-intelligence investment trade.  The stock had been one of the market’s top performers over the past six months, outpacing its larger rival,  Nvidia  by nearly 36% in terms of overall gains.  It also was up more than 40% from its early October close heading into the release Tuesday of fourth-quarter earnings, powered in part by a multi-billion dollar deal with OpenAI to deploy its next-generation GPUs in exchange for warrants that could see the ChatGPT maker owning as much as 10% of AMD outstanding stock.

headline: Alphabet Aims for 12 Consecutive Quarterly Earnings Beats When It Reports Today
summary: Alphabet reports Q4 2025 earnings today after market close. After being one of only two Magnificent Seven companies that outperformed the S&P 500 last year, Wall Street is expecting EPS of $2.64, up nearly 23% year-over-year (YOY), on revenue near $113 billion, up around 15% YOY. Shares have gained nearly 63% over the past year ... Alphabet Aims for 12 Consecutive Quarterly Earnings Beats When It Reports Today

headline: Google Earnings: What The Buy Side Expects From Cloud Computing Business
summary: EPS growth for Google stock is expected to slow in 2026. But the cloud computing unit's revenue growth could provide boost.

headline: Will Amazon's Q4 Earnings Benefit From Healthy AWS Momentum?
summary: AMZN's Q4 results due Feb. 5 may get a lift from strong AWS momentum, with AI-driven cloud demand and consensus calling for 21.6% sales growth.
